How do Verus PBaaS chains inherit their consensus mechanism, and is it customizable?

Newly created Verus PBaaS chains inherit the 50/50% PoW/PoS consensus mechanism from the main Verus blockchain. While this percentage is currently fixed, it may be customizable in the future, allowing creators to tailor their chain's consensus mechanism to their specific needs.

Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS): Launch Your Own Blockchain
Verus sees a future where anyone can create their own blockchain in an easy fashion. Every blockchain in the ecosystem is independent and customizable. To create a chain one needs to have the VerusID name of the chain.
Chains can be nested to any level, so that a chain, say “NewChain”, that is launched with a VerusID on the main Verus blockchain, can be used to spawn an unlimited amount of new chains, each of these using identities on NewChain, which can be acquired at any cost as selected by the creator of NewChain.
New chains inherit the 50/50% PoW/PoS consensus mechanism. This percentage might be customizable in the future.
A newly created chain can be mined by the miners of VerusCoin. A miner in the VerusCoin ecosystem can mine up to 22 different PBaaS-chains without losing any of the original hash power. This is called Merge-Mining and means that a creator of the chain doesn’t have to worry about creating their own mining infrastructure.
PBaaS chains will form the basis for a practically unlimited scalability of the Verus system. Popular currencies and tokens can exist and be interchangeable on many Verus blockchains, so that they won’t be restricted or limited by the capacities of a single blockchain.
A chain can have certain characteristics like launches with Kickstarter-like minimums to activate or, if not met, automatically refund. Other options include dynamic coin launch pricing based on participation, pre-launch participation price discounts, pre-conversion reserve currency carve outs, and price-neutral launch pre-allocations. Additionally the creator can specify coin supply, coin emission with up to three era’s and define the price for identities. All specified in easy to understand commands and parameters, no programming necessary.Multi-Reserve Currencies: DeFi Reimagined

How does mining work for Verus PBaaS chains, and what benefits does it offer to miners and chain creators?

Verus PBaaS chains can be mined by VerusCoin miners, who can mine up to 22 different PBaaS chains without losing any of their original hash power. This is called Merge-Mining, and it means that chain creators don't need to worry about setting up their own mining infrastructure. Miners can benefit from the increased mining opportunities, while chain creators can focus on building their blockchain without worrying about mining.

What kinds of customization options do Verus PBaaS chains offer, and how are they specified?

Verus PBaaS chains offer a range of customization options, including Kickstarter-like minimums to activate, dynamic coin launch pricing, pre-launch participation price discounts, pre-conversion reserve currency carve-outs, and price-neutral launch pre-allocations. Additionally, creators can specify coin supply, coin emission with up to three eras, and define the price for identities. All these options are specified using easy-to-understand commands and parameters, with no programming required.
